net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class TableToTreeModelAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.TableToTreeModelAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, TableModelListener, TableModel, TreeModel

    public class TableToTreeModelAdapter
extends Object
implements TableModel, TreeModel, TableModelListener
    This class uses a TableModel to implement both a TableModel and TreeModel. Some protected methods are added to allow a tree structure to be provided based on the rows.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TableToTreeModelAdapter.RowTreeObject
      A wrapper object for objects returned from column 0 in the TableModel.

      • getChild

        public Object getChild(Object parent,
              int index)
        Implementation for getting a child. Override this method only for child objects returned for your row objects. The root is handled here by using the first column of each row. The next level, the row objects, will call getChildForRow(). After that, this method is called and should be overridden to provide any further depths.
        Specified by:
        getChild in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        index - The index of the child.
        Returns:
        The child object.

      • getChildCount

        public int getChildCount(Object parent)
        Children are handling similarly as the getChild(). Returns the number of children of parent. The parent object will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Specified by:
        getChildCount in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        Returns:
        The number of children at this node.

      • getChildCountForRow

        protected int getChildCountForRow(int row)
        Get the child count for the row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row.
        Returns:
        zero.

      • getNodeId

        public String getNodeId(Object node)
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel

        Get an unique ID for the node. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the node in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Specified by:
        getNodeId in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        node - The tree node.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Returns the number of rows in the model. If the number of rows cannot be efficiently determined, this method may return -1. In that case the isRowValid() method can be used to determine if a given row is valid.
        Specified by:
        getRowCount in interface TableModel
        Returns:
        The number of rows or -1 if the number of rows cannot efficiently be calculated.

      • getRowId

        public String getRowId(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel

        Get an unqiue ID for the row. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the row in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent. When accessing the table model, the ID may be used to find the row index.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Specified by:
        getRowId in interface TableModel
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.

      • getValueAt

        public Object getValueAt(int rowIndex,
                int columnIndex)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.
        Specified by:
        getValueAt in interface TableModel
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index, in the interval [0,getRowCount()], may be zero even if getRowCount() is zero.
        columnIndex - The column index, in the interval [0,getColumnCount()), may be zero even if getColumnCount() is zero.
        Returns:
        Object or null, must return null if the row or column index are invalid.

      • getValueAt

        public Object getValueAt(TreePath path,
                int columnIndex)
        Override to handle tree depths of more than 2. The depth can be found by calling path.getPathCount(). Be sure to call this method for depths <=2. Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and path. Column zero should return an object that is either the same or equal to the object returned by getChild() or equivalently path. getLastPathComponent().
        Specified by:
        getValueAt in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        The value object.

      • isCellEditable

        public boolean isCellEditable(int rowIndex,
                     int columnIndex)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Returns true if the cell at rowIndex and columnIndex is editable.
        Specified by:
        isCellEditable in interface TableModel
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        columnIndex - The column index, in the interval [0,getColumnCount()).
        Returns:
        true if the cell may be edited.

      • isCellEditable

        public boolean isCellEditable(TreePath path,
                     int columnIndex)
        Override to handle tree depths of more than 2. The depth can be found by calling path.getPathCount(). Be sure to call this method for depths <=2. Returns true if the cell at path and columnIndex is editable.
        Specified by:
        isCellEditable in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        true if the cell may be edited.

        Returns:

      • isLeaf

        public boolean isLeaf(Object node)
        Description copied from interface: TreeModel
        Returns true if node is a leaf. If this method returns true then it is assumed this node cannot have children. No calls to getChildCount() or getChild() will be made. In most medium implementations, nodes that return true will not have an expand/collapse control, nodes that return false may always have an expand collapse control, but may have no child nodes.
        Specified by:
        isLeaf in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        node - The object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the node cannot have children.

      • isLeafForRow

        protected boolean isLeafForRow(int row)
        Determines if the row is a leaf.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index.
        Returns:
        true

      • isRowValid

        public boolean isRowValid(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from interface: TableModel
        Returns true if the row is valid in this model. In general a row should be valid if it is less than the value of getRowCount(). Determining getRowCount() may not be efficient for all models so this method is provided to determine if a given row is valid. It is assumed that if a row is invalid, all the rows with an index greater than the row checked are also invalid.
        Specified by:
        isRowValid in interface TableModel
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        true if the row is valid.

      • setValueAt

        public void setValueAt(Object aValue,
              TreePath path,
              int columnIndex)
        Override to handle tree depths of more than 2. The depth can be found by calling path.getPathCount(). Be sure to call this method for depths <=2. Sets the value in the cell at columnIndex and path to aValue
        Specified by:
        setValueAt in interface TreeModel
        Parameters:
        aValue - The new value for the column.
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
